tokens.text: validates base game version in world template manifests

title: Base Game Version
description: Validates base_game_version in world template manifests and checks that it matches the current Minecraft version. Can suggest updates to bring base_game_version in line with the latest version.

fields.title: Base Version Undefined
fields.description: Checks that the world template manifest has a header/base_game_version field defined. This field is required for world templates.
fields.howToUse: Add base_game_version to your world template manifest header. Example: "base_game_version": [1, 21, 0]. Use the Minecraft version your world was created with.

fields.title: Major Version Low
fields.description: The base_game_version major version number is lower than the current Minecraft version. This may cause compatibility issues.
fields.howToUse: Update base_game_version to the current Minecraft version using the 'Fix' button, or manually edit the manifest header to use the latest version array.

fields.title: Major Version High
fields.description: The base_game_version major version number is higher than the current Minecraft version. This indicates an invalid future version.
fields.howToUse: Lower the base_game_version to match the current Minecraft release. Future versions are not valid.

fields.title: Minor Version Low
fields.description: The base_game_version minor version number is lower than the current or previous minor version. Consider updating to ensure compatibility.
fields.howToUse: Update the base_game_version minor version to current using the 'Fix' button for automatic update.

fields.title: Minor Version High
fields.description: The base_game_version minor version number is higher than the current Minecraft version. This indicates an invalid future version.
fields.howToUse: The minor version is ahead of the current release. Update to a valid current version.

fields.title: Patch Version Low
fields.description: The base_game_version patch version number is lower than the current Minecraft version. Consider updating for the latest fixes.
fields.howToUse: Update the patch version to current using the 'Fix' button, or manually update in the manifest.

fields.title: Patch Version High
fields.description: The base_game_version patch version number is higher than the current Minecraft version. This indicates an invalid future version.

fields.title: Version Retrieval Failed
fields.description: Internal error: Could not retrieve the latest Minecraft version from the database.

fields.title: Version Parse Failed
fields.description: Internal error: Could not parse the latest Minecraft version string into version components.
fields.technicalDescription: Data field contains the version string that failed to parse.
